description:
Currently a server can be built without a public IPv4 or IPv6 address.

Server build should fail if unable to allocate both public IPv4 and IPv6.
title: Fail build if IP allocation fails

comments.content:
Currently a server can be built without a public IPv4 or IPv6 address.

Server build should fail if unable to allocate both public IPv4 and IPv6.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~maheshp

comments.content: Can you provide more details.  Do you mean that networks were requested and the allocation failed, or that a server can be built with no requested networks?  The first one is a bug but the second one is not IMO.  An instance isn't terribly useful without networking but if that's what a user requests then everything is working fine.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~alaski

comments.content:
As you have mentioned, the bug is when network is requested but IP allocation fails. 

If IP allocation fails for some reason and if the server is built, the server would not be accessible.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mahesh-panchaks

comments.content: An instance can also be booted with a private IP - in such a case the instance cannot fail the build since it won't be pingable. Nova really doesn't care about the activation - that's  a post boot process. It just facilitates it.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sbiswas7

comments.content: It would be good to have a reproduce scenario here
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague
